item.title: Common API Vulnerabilities
item.description: Information Disclosure Information may be disclosed in API responses or public sources such as code repositories, search results, news, social media, the targetâ€™s website, and public API directories. For example, a site that is using the WordPress API may unknowingly be sharing user information with anyone who navigates to the API path /wp-json/wp/v2/users GET https://www.sitename.org/wp-json/wp/v2/users [{"id":1,"name":"Administrator", "slug":"admin"}], {"id":2,"name":"Vincent Valentine", "slug":"Vincent"}] These slugs can then be used in an attempt to log in as the disclosed users with a brute-force, credential-stuffing, or password-spraying attack.
